schemas.description: Five different UKIDSS databases contain calibrated data from the UKIRT Wide Field Camera (WFCAM).

tables.description: Deep Extragalactic Survey (DXS) 35 sq.deg. K=21 on completion. Longer exposures, and stacked over many nights.
Galactic Cluster Survey (GCS) on completion, 1000 sq. deg. to K=18.7. Short exposures, unstacked, but later 2nd pass.
Galactic Plane Survey (GPS) on completion, 1800 sq.deg. to K=19.0. Main survey : short exposures, unstacked, but later 2nd pass. Some deeper stacked sub-components.
Large Area Survey (LAS) : on completion, 4000 sq.deg. to K=18.4. Short exposures, unstacked, but later 2nd pass.
Ultra Deep Survey (UDS) : 0.75 sq.deg. K=23 on completion. Very long exposure, stacked over many many nights.

The galactic dust extinction value measured from the Schlegel, Finkbeiner & Davis (1998) maps. This uses the correction given in Bonifacio, Monai & Beers (2000). This correction reduces the extinction value in regions of high extinction (E(B-V)>0.1)
